intro: Drimyspermum australe, commonly known as the Australian drimys, is a shrub native to southern Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant features aromatic leaves with a distinctive, spicy scent. It produces small, white flowers that bloom in spring, followed by dark, fleshy berries. Drimyspermum australe is adapted to dry, sandy soils and is often found in heathland and woodland habitats.
